events.name: Data Journalism Summit | A two-day Datafest on immigration
events.about:
Dates/Times: Saturday, December 8th, 2012 from 10:00am and continue through Sunday, December 9th, 2012 with hacking completing at 4:00pm and winners announced at 5:00pm (PST)

Cost: FREE, plus we will provide food and prizes

Event Focus:  Fun, food and numbers mash-up to build a data visualization tool or mobile application using open data on immigration.

Journalists, developers, coders, designers, and open data activists – you are all invited!

If youve never been to a hackathon before, this is your opportunity. We will explore open data sources and mix them with a little coding, design, and a little web tech to create something new.

Hackathons are also a great place to meet other people and start new projects!

What skills are needed?

All the skills youll need are your enthusiasm and willingness to have a great time at our hackathon. If you know a few programming languages, this event is for you; but if you have a desire to learn digital map design, basic programming, cellphone video production, or interactive graphics; this event is for you as well.

Bring ideas, your laptop, and help shape the future of information.

Data:

The organizers will provide the data for the hackathon. The data will be in CSV, Excel and SPPS formats to speed up the event.

Goals:

Create teams with at least one programmer, journalist and designer. The goal for each group is to build data visualizations on immigration that will be accessible to media outlets and non-profit organizations in a short period of time

Please spread the word!

events.name: Windows 8 Unleashed - Los Angeles
events.about:
Windows 8 Unleashed - Full Day of Hands-On Programming, B.Y.O. Laptop!

Windows 8 is the single biggest opportunity for developers EVER! Come to a “Windows 8 Unleashed” event to kick-start your Windows 8 development. “Windows 8 Unleashed” is a series of FREE events run by your local community friends and leaders, and are great whether you are an experienced .NET developer, or even if you are just getting started. We’ll spend the morning in lecture and hands on labs. Half way through, you’ll get a chance to take what you learned in the morning and compete in a hackathon with a chance to win some great prizes!

Required Software and Downloads

Please make sure to get the required software and downloads BEFORE coming to the event. You can find everything you need on the “Windows 8 Unleashed Installs” page. 

Agenda

Session I – Overview

  • ·Metro Style Apps Overview
  • ·Developing Metro Style Apps
  • ·Working with Controls
  • ·Implementing Navigation

Session II – Location and Data

  • ·Working with Location
  • ·Data Binding
  • ·Roaming
  • ·App Bar

Session III – Metro Principals

  • ·Live Tiles & Toast
  • ·Contracts
  • ·Full, Fill Snap and Portrait Views
  • ·Advertising

Build an App and Win Money and Prizes!

Our sponsors have stepped up with some awesome prizes. Not only do you get a ton of information for FREE, but you have an opportunity to win some awesome stuff! You can’t afford to miss this!

DAY-OF prizes will be awarded (sponsored by PDSA):

  • ·1st Place: $500 Gift Card
  • ·2nd Place: $200 Gift Card
  • ·3rd Place: $100 Gift Card

“Best Overall App” Prizes will be awarded to the best app from ALL unleashed events:

  • ·$10,000 from Component Art
  • ·Windows 8 Tablet from PDSA, Inc.

In addition all attendees will receive a FREE eBook from O’Reilly

events.name: Petcentric Hackathon
events.about:
Petcentric Hackathon is the first ever pet-focused hackathon aimed at bringing the Los Angeles tech community together to generate ideas and products that help people engage with their pets.

Please join us for this exciting event located on the Amplify campus in Venice. We are looking for anything and everything to be built - this could range from mobile apps, to web apps, phsyical projects, installations, etc.  

Food will be provided and pets are welcome!

Prizes: 

1st Prize: $3,000    2nd Prize: $1,000    3rd Prize: $500 

Schedule:

Saturday November 17th

9:00 AM – Check-In/Breakfast (please note, participants must register ahead of time)

10 AM - Petcentric Presentation and Opening Kick-Off

10:30 AM - Hackathon Begins

12:30 PM - Lunch

1:30 PM - Hacking

9 PM - Demos

10 PM - Judge deliberations

10:30 PM - Awards

Judges: TBD

Organizers:

 

Petcentric Hosted by Purina is a fun online community for people who love their pets! Find games, articles, photos and videos about cats and dogs. Petcentric gives animal lovers an easy-to-use guide for finding pet friendly places and information anytime, anywhere. 

Amplify is a hands-on startup accelerator and multi–faceted entrepreneurial campus located in Los Angeles.

Reach Entertainment is an independent entertainment and content strategy agency located in Los Angeles. 

Media Partner:

           

Poster:

events.name: Los Angeles CleanWeb Hackathon
events.about:
The Cleanweb Hackathon will demonstrate the impact of applying information technology to resource constraints. Join us November 16-18 in Los Angeles as we bring together developers, designers, students and business professionals dedicated to optimizing resource use and accelerating cleantech development. Participants are tasked with building applications that tackle energy, waste, water, and other sustainability issues by leveraging web and mobile technologies. We challenge attendees on what they can do over the course of the weekend that might just change the world (and LA) for the better.

Saturday and Sunday’s Events will be held at at the beautiful University of Southern California Tutor Campus Center Forum. Friday night kick-off location TBA.

events.name: UCLA Hack Olympics
events.about:
UCLA CS Majors -- Youre invited to the first ever 24hr UCLA Hack Olympics!

HackUCLA is hosting its first ever 24-hour hackathon on October 20th-21st, sponsored by UCLA alums and the top LA startup incubators. The event will be held just off campus at Originate Labs (Wilshire and Veteran). Well be handing out more than $40,000 worth of awesome prizes courtesy of our generous sponsors!!

Admission is free for teams with at least one UCLA student or alum, and you can apply as a team or as an individual. Individuals will have time to join or form teams at the beginning of the event. Come with an existing idea or project, or create something new!

In the spirit of Hack Olympics, we will have one Grand Prize winner and several Medalists. Hackers will have 24 hours to build and hone their creations before presenting before our expert panel. Well be handing out more than $40,000 worth of awesome prizes courtesy of our sponsors, with a Grand Prize hosting package valued at $30,000!! The Grand Prize winners will also get an automatic interview with Howard Marks (founder of Acclaim, Activision) the founder of StartEngine startup accelerator in Westwood. Medals will be given out in different categories with prize packages from $3,000 to $5,000.

The UCLA Hack Olympics is a great way for YOU, our hackers and designers, to get hands on experience applying the skills youve learned in the classroom in the real-world! We all know there is a big difference between learning concepts in a lecture and using those concepts to create something awesome that people can use -- heres a chance to gain valuable, applicable coding experience in a fun and exciting environment!

UCLA alums deep in the LA startup community will share their insights about starting a company and hold Q&A sessions. Youll also receive real feedback on your hacks from a talented team of judges who evaluate startups for a living. Get noticed, get out here, start hacking!!

 

To participate as a team or individual, or for more information about the event, go to http://hackolympics.splashthat.com/ and RSVP!

 

If applying as a team, register online and email alvinhsia@ucla.edu with the name of your team and its members.

 

Join the Facebook group HackUCLA https://www.facebook.com/groups/hackucla to stay updated on future events!

Directions:

Fandango is located at 12200 W. Olympic Blvd., Suite 400, Los Angeles, CA 90064 in the Westside Media Center. Our building is on the southwest corner of Bundy and Olympic.

Take the 10 freeway west. Exit Bundy Dr. North. Go straight, just before you hit Olympic, there will be a driveway on the left. Turn into the driveway and go to the underground parking. Alternatively, you can enter from the driveway on Olympic Blvd. just past both buildings on the south side of the street.

events.name: USC Startup Weekend 9/28
events.about:
For all event details, visit usc.startupweekend.org

Thanks!

Startup Weekend Crew

 

Refund Policy:  No refunds will be granted within 10 days of the event. Apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

About Startup Weekend: Startup Weekends are 54-hour events designed to provide superior experiential education for technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.  Beginning with Friday night pitches and continuing through brainstorming, business plan development, and basic prototype creation, Startup Weekends culminate in Sunday night demos and presentations.  Participants create working startups during the event and are able to collaborate with like-minded individuals outside of their daily networks. All teams hear talks by industry leaders and receive valuable feedback from local entrepreneurials. The weekend is centered around action, innovation, and education.  Whether you are looking for feedback on a idea, a co-founder, specific skill sets, or a team to help you execute, Startup Weekends are the perfect environment in which to test your idea and take the first steps towards launching your own startup.

events.name: Windows 8 Boot to VHD Event - Los Angeles (September 14, 2012)
events.about:
My team is hosting Windows 8 Boot Camps / Hackathons to help get developers up to speed on Windows 8 Development.  I may not be a developer, but I can still help the developer community get their machines up and running on Windows 8 today without having to wipe out their existing Windows 7 installation.

Since the actual RTM bits are not quite available yet, I will have bootable thumb drives with Windows 8 Release Preview and Windows Server 2012 Release Candidate.  In addition, I will also provide VHD files that have Windows Server 2012 Release Candidate and Windows 8 Release Preview preinstalled so that we can configure your machine with Boot to VHD (no repartitioning required and keeps your existing OS intact).

The only requirement for your computer is that you have Windows 7 or higher installed (required for Boot to VHD) and no drive encryption enabled (e.g. bitlocker, etc.).

If you would like to grab the files prior to arriving at the event, I have put the preinstalled VHDs here: http://aka.ms/hwitcampfiles.  Please download the ISO images here: http://aka.ms/hwws2012 and http://windows.microsoft.com/en-US/windows-8/download.

The event will take place at the Los Angeles Microsoft Office located at 333 Grand Ave., Suite 3300, Los Angeles, CA 90071

Date: Friday, September 14, 2012

Start Time: 4:45PM

End Time: 7:00 PM

events.name: Digital LA - Hackathon LA
events.about:
Digital LA and Verifico are teaming up to present Hackathon LA! Developers and biz types with ideas will break up into several teams of 3-5 people to work on a biz plan and code a prototype in 24 hours, with judges determining cash and prizes.

Biz types: Come with your business / app / site pitch ($75 registration) Attendees will vote on pitches at the event, and half of pitches will be selected for hack teams to create prototypes (open source).

Developers: Email info@digitalla.net with HACKDEV as the subject and your languages. We will email you a discount code link to register for FREE.

AGENDA
- Friday April 27
6-6:30: Check-in and Networking
6:30-7p: Pitches: Biz types can pitch their ideas (1-2 min each)
7-7:30p: Voting: Developers pick their fave ideas to work on. Half will be selected.
7:30-8p. Pizza Dinner + Form Teams; each team consists of 1-2 biz types and 2-3 developers. Over the next 24 hours, the biz types will work on the PPT investor-style presentation including idea, product, team bios, market opportunity, competitors, and marketing/customer acquisition plan. Developers will code a prototype on an open server. All code created is open to all (not owned by anyone).
8p-midnight: Teams work on Projects

- Saturday April 28.
9a: Doors Open. Breakfast served. Teams Work on Projects.
1-2p. Lunch served. Teams Work on Projects
6p. Dinner served + Code Freeze
7-8:30p. Presentations
8:30-9p. Judges judge.
9p. Winners announced (at nearby bar venue). Judges will determine winners based on viability (30%), technical (30%), creativity (30%) and presentation (10%).
9-11p. Awards Ceremony and Cocktail Reception (bar TBD).

Team Prizes: $500 first prize. Additional prizes will be awarded depending on number of entrants; additional prizes include sponsor prizes and title prizes for Best Team Name, Best Presentation, etc.

Thanks to our Sponsors:

Verifico.com is the only secure community where borrowers, loan professionals offering funding services, and referrers with clients can connect safely and easily. Verifico gives all parties the tools needed to complete transactions in the same secure community, with a marketplace for verified financial services, personal dashboards, bank level data encryption, secure payment features, and more...all for free. http://www.verifico.com/ @TheVerifico

CALL FOR SPONSORS: Email info@digitalla.net with HACKATHON as subject. We are looking for sponsors for food, in-kind tech products (keyboard, monitor) and prize money. Sponsors get signage at event, logo placement and company description on event material.

events.name: April Hackathon at DreamHost
events.about:
Its PyLadies Hackathon time! This event is open to anyone that wants to start or work on their own Python projects, find help or collaborators to an existing project. Bring your laptop and your desire to program!

All experience levels are welcome. Beginners can get help if they are still working through Learn Python the Hard Way or something similar. Programmers can work in a programmer-friendly environment and get extra eyes on a bug they are trying to tackle. There will also be lightning talks so please dont hesitate to show off something youve learned or used.

$15 includes coffee, lunch, drinks/sodas, and all-day hacking.

Schedule

  • 9:30-10am Registration, meet-and-greet, coffee.
  • 10am-12:30pm Coding time: break out into the project room of your choice and start coding.
  • 12:30-1:15pm Lunch. Go around the room discussing progress and goals for the afternoon.
  • 1:15-2pm Lightning talks.
  • 2-6pm More coding!
  • 6pm + Socializing at a nearby bar/restaurant in Downtown LA!

Code of Conduct

All participants are expected to come with laptops, ready to work on their own coding projects. This is an event for programmers and people learning to program.

This is not a networking event. If you come purely to recruit/bother developers who are trying to focus on programming, you will be asked to leave.

Lets keep this a productive, distraction-free environment for attendees who want to code. We are also dedicated to providing a harassment-free experience for everyone. Anyone acting inappropriately will be warned and/or asked to leave.

Parking and Public Transportation

There is parking available at nearby paid lots starting around $6 per day. Carpooling and taking public transportation is encouraged, there is a Metro stop around the corner at 7st Street / Metro Center.

Questions?

Email christine (at) pyladies.com for more details! Hope to see you there!

events.name: Trojan Hack
events.about:
Trojan Hack is the first 24-hour hackathon located at the University of Southern California. Students from any University in the Los Angeles area will team up and compete to see which school really has the best programmers and entrepreneurs. The event is hosted by USC Stevens Institute for Innovation.

  • When: 6:00PM Friday, February 3rd – 6:00PM Saturday, February 4th
  • Where: The Forum in the Ronald Tutor Campus Center, University of Southern California, California
  • What: The event begins Friday evening featuring 5-minute tech talks from sponsoring companies. Hacking will continue until 3:00PM Saturday, followed by demos from 3-4:30.
  • Who: All college students in the Southern California area
  • Judging: TBA

Background

Inspired by Pennapps and TechCrunch Disrupt, Trojan Hack was created by two USC students looking to bring the awesomeness of hackathons back to their school. But they didn’t want to throw just any hackathon… They wanted to start a competition so fierce that it would settle the rivalry between USC and UCLA once in for all. Any other school that believes they have what it takes to take down the Trojans and the Bears are more than welcome to try.
events.address: 3415 S. Figueroa St. in the Forum Room on the fourth floor of the Ronald Tutor Campus Center at the University of Southern California
